intro: Sempervivum globiferum subsp. pseudohirtum, commonly known as the Woolly Hens and Chicks, is a succulent plant native to the mountainous regions of Central Asia. It is characterized by its rosettes of thick, fleshy, woolly leaves that are typically green with a bluish or purplish tinge. The plant produces small, star-shaped flowers in shades of pink or white during the summer months. It thrives in well-drained soil and full sun, making it a popular choice for rock gardens and alpine displays. Due to its compact size and drought tolerance, it is well-suited for xeriscaping and container gardening.
